meanings.definition: Of the highest quality or degree.
meanings.sent1: She received a superlative grade on her test.
meanings.sent2: The chef's superlative skills were evident in every dish he prepared.
meanings.sent3: His superlative taste in music always led to fun dance parties.
meanings.sent4: The sunset painted the sky in superlative shades of pink and orange.
meanings.sent5: The superlative view from the mountaintop took her breath away.

meanings.definition: Exceeding all others in quality or degree.
meanings.sent1: The superlative performance of the lead actor captivated the audience.
meanings.sent2: Her superlative talent in painting was recognized by art critics worldwide.
meanings.sent3: The superlative speed of the cheetah made it the fastest animal on land.
meanings.sent4: The superlative beauty of the Taj Mahal left visitors in awe.
meanings.sent5: The superlative effort she put into her work always paid off.

meanings.definition: A word or form expressing the highest or a very high degree of a quality.
meanings.sent1: In the sentence, 'best' is a superlative.
meanings.sent2: The term 'fastest' is a superlative used to show extreme speed.
meanings.sent3: The use of 'most' as a superlative always emphasizes the top level.
meanings.sent4: The superlative 'tallest' is often used when describing skyscrapers.
meanings.sent5: The superlative 'brightest' is used to describe the most intense light sources.
